extension.name: org.apache.nifi.hazelcast.services.cacheclient.HazelcastMapCacheClient
extension.description: An implementation of DistributedMapCacheClient that uses Hazelcast as the backing cache. This service relies on an other controller service, manages the actual Hazelcast calls, set in Hazelcast Cache Manager.

property.name: hazelcast-cache-manager
property.description: A Hazelcast Cache Manager which manages connections to Hazelcast and provides cache instances.

property.name: hazelcast-cache-name
property.description: The name of a given cache. A Hazelcast cluster may handle multiple independent caches, each identified by a name. Clients using caches with the same name are working on the same data structure within Hazelcast.

property.name: hazelcast-entry-ttl
property.description: Indicates how long the written entries should exist in Hazelcast. Setting it to '0 secs' means that the datawill exists until its deletion or until the Hazelcast server is shut down. Using `EmbeddedHazelcastCacheManager` ascache manager will not provide policies to limit the size of the cache.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.hazelcast.services.cachemanager.EmbeddedHazelcastCacheManager
extension.description: A service that runs embedded Hazelcast and provides cache instances backed by that. The server does not ask for authentication, it is recommended to run it within secured network.

property.name: hazelcast-port
property.description: Port for the Hazelcast instance to use.

property.name: hazelcast-clustering-strategy
property.description: Specifies with what strategy the Hazelcast cluster should be created.

allowableValue.description: No high availability or data replication is provided, every node has access only to the data stored locally.

Creates Hazelcast cluster based on the NiFi cluster: It expects every NiFi nodes to have a running Hazelcast instance on the same port as specified in the Hazelcast Port property. No explicit listing of the instances is needed.

Works with an explicit list of Hazelcast instances, creating a cluster using the listed instances. This provides greater control, making it possible to utilize only certain nodes as Hazelcast servers. The list of Hazelcast instances can be set in the property "Hazelcast Instances". The list items must refer to hosts within the NiFi cluster, no external Hazelcast is allowed. NiFi nodes are not listed will be join to the Hazelcast cluster as clients.

property.name: hazelcast-instances
property.description: Only used with "Explicit" Clustering Strategy! List of NiFi instance host names which should be part of the Hazelcast cluster. Host names are separated by comma. The port specified in the "Hazelcast Port" property will be used as server port. The list must contain every instance that will be part of the cluster. Other instances will join the Hazelcast cluster as clients.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.hazelcast.services.cachemanager.ExternalHazelcastCacheManager
extension.description: A service that provides cache instances backed by Hazelcast running outside of NiFi.

property.name: hazelcast-server-address
property.description: Addresses of one or more the Hazelcast instances, using {host:port} format, separated by comma.

property.name: hazelcast-retry-backoff-initial
property.description: The amount of time the client waits before it tries to reestablish connection for the first time.

property.name: hazelcast-retry-backoff-maximum
property.description: The maximum amount of time the client waits before it tries to reestablish connection.

property.name: hazelcast-retry-backoff-multiplier
property.description: A multiplier by which the wait time is increased before each attempt to reestablish connection.

property.name: hazelcast-connection-timeout
property.description: The maximum amount of time the client tries to connect or reconnect before giving up.
